intro: Patrinia formosana, commonly known as the Formosan Patrinia, is a herbaceous plant native to East Asia, particularly Taiwan. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and sage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from white to pale purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Patrinia formosana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream sides.
